results.title: The Field mouse
results.creator_credit: Steve Helling and Scandinavian Videocassette Group
results.brief_description: The life cycle, habits and characteristics of the field mouse are shown in the context of its ecosystem. Highlights factors such as food availability, predators, population levels and adaptive behaviour. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: The Fall of Communism as seen in gay pornography
results.brief_description: Using excerpts, shots and screen tests from pornography produced in Eastern Europe and Russia, this startling documentary refutes the libertarian aesthetics of much of western queer politics. By forcing us to contemplate the faces of the young male models, it reminds us that even with the fall of communism, materialism and history still have a place in our thinking about film.

results.title: The Fair persuaders
results.brief_description: This film tells of how American women belonging to the League of Women Voters help inform the electorate about issues of civic and political campaigns, to bring about fuller public participation.

results.title: The Fad diet circus
results.brief_description: Shows the potential hazards of fad diets, which seldom result in long-term weight loss. Compares two groups of dieters, one on a well balanced diet and the other on a low carbohydrate diet. Shows how both groups lose weight but the low carbohydrate group experiences medical problems.

results.title: The Face of North Sydney (PC)
results.brief_description: This disc contains over 3,700 photographs, the full text of “Naming North Sydney” (an historical dictionary of place names) and the full text of 24 heritage leaflets. It has been produced by North Sydney Council’s Stanton Library. The Local Studies Collection, from which the photographs are taken is located within the library (234 Miller Street, North Sydney).

results.title: The Eyes have it...or do they?
results.brief_description: Explores the major aspects of vision and the way in which it determines one’s conception of the world. Suggests that physically different eyes perceive reality differently. Shows the influence of physical and chemical stiumlation on the eye and discusses sensitivity to color, light, shadow, form and line.

results.title: The Eyes have it
results.creator_credit: Dave Gilbert, National Society for the Prevention of Blindness and Interkal Productions
results.brief_description: Marionettes led by an owl accompanied by a piano playing fox and the fern forest orchestra sing a song of advice about eye care. Other marionettes act out the words of the song. Later the song is repeated, with some different activities while the words are flashed on the screen.

results.title: The Eye of the beholder
results.brief_description: Illustrates the idea that people often see what they want to see, what they are prepared to see and not what actually exists. A series of incidents involving an artist who appears to be involved in the murder of a woman are presented. These show how he appears to his mother, to a waiter, a cab driver, his landlord and a cleaning lady. The story, as seen through the eyes of these beholders is quite different from what we see when the entire incident is repeated as it actually happened. The films emphasises the importance of caution in judging people and that no two people see the same thing the same way.

results.title: The Expedition of T. Mitchell
results.brief_description:
The arrival of T.Mitchell from the United Kingdom to Australia with convicts in tow. Subsequently one morning, T.Mitchell awoke to find his camp robbed by the convicts.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.
